Description: Small pale-red sandy marl pottery vase with small flat base, convex body, short neck and rounded rim, one side has been flattened before firing. There are two deep diagonal slashes on shoulder made before firing.
Findspot: Excavated/Findspot: Kom el-Ahmar, Fort Cemetery Grave 152? (Hierakonpolis)
Curator's comments: The flattening of one side may have been done to join it to another pot, creating a double vessel. The tomb number is worn and only 2F remains. The pot was attributed to Grave 152 by Barbara Adams in The Fort Cemetery at Hierakonpolis, London (1987), p. 156 and 227.
Acquisition name: Donated by: Frederick George Hilton Price
